fko.chessly.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • fko.chessly.mvc.ModelObservable
        • fko.chessly.game.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.Observer

    public class Game
extends ModelObservable
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.util.Observer

    This class handles everything needed to run a Chessly rules compliant game.

    The game class controls a single game of chess using mainly a board and 2 players. It also has 2 timers for each of the players.

    A game object can have the one of following states (defined in the Game class as constant fields):
    INITIALIZED | RUNNING | PAUSED | STOPPED | OVER | FINISHED

    A game can be in state OVER exactly if:

    1. There are no more moves at all OR
    2. Time is up for at least one player OR
    3. One User has resigned the game
    When a game is OVER there must be a WINNER or it is a DRAW.

    A game runs in a separate thread and must be started (startGame) after creation.

    A game needs two Players, times for the players if the game is timed.

    It knows which player has to do a move and asks the player for a move. If the player returns a move it is checked if it is a legal move.
    The class also checks if a game is over because there are no more moves our because a player ran out of time.

    A game can be paused and resumed which stops the timers for the players.

    Author:
    fkopp

      • GAMEOVER_NONE

        public static final int GAMEOVER_NONE
        Reason for status GAME_OVER: None. Should game be over at all? If game is in status GAME_OVER this indicates a problem with the status handling. Query the game over reason with get_gameOverCause()

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Game is an Observer to Clocks (Observable) and this implements the Observer interface. It is only called when the time is up meaning the clock reached the alarm.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
